task_summary: Detect the pink cloth, approach and make gentle contact near an edge, then push to fold it over itself, pause to settle, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A single-arm manipulator must fold a pink cloth on a tabletop. The robot first ensures the cloth is visible; if not, it scans the workspace. With the gripper opened, it moves above the cloth, aligns to the edge, and lowers until contact is detected. Using the end-effector, it performs a directed push along the surface to flip part of the cloth over, forming a fold. After a short wait to let the cloth settle, the arm retreats to a safe position. The sequence prioritizes precise alignment and gentle contact suitable for deformable objects.
preconditions: Camera provides top-down view of the cloth
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move above the target area.
Precisely align to a cloth edge.
Lower until contact with low force.
Push along the table to flip part of the cloth (fold).
Wait briefly for cloth to settle.
success_criteria: A visible fold in the cloth after the push
No slippage or loss of control during contact
Robot ends in a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: Insufficient fold → repeat push with corrected start point
Excessive drag or snagging → retreat and retry from a different angle
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when a fold is formed and the robot retreats to a safe pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: Initial firm contact with cloth edge; alignment to push direction is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation should follow to create the fold.

node_specs.description: Checks if the cloth is currently visible.
Scan the workspace to locate the cloth if not visible.
Prepare for surface contact by opening gripper.
Move to a pre-contact pose above the cloth.
Align the tool to the cloth edge for a straight push.
Gently lower until contact with the cloth/table.
Push along the surface to flip part of the cloth and form a fold.
Brief pause to allow the cloth to settle after folding.
Back off to a safe distance after the fold.

failure_modes: Misalignment at edge causing poor fold
Insufficient contact leading to no flip
assumptions: Frames show end-effector pushing the cloth edge to create a fold rather than pinching; plan uses surface push accordingly.

expected_success_criteria: No cloth displacement beyond intended fold
